description: The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat requires the expertise of an external company to determine the mileage reimbursement rates. These rates will be used for two directives of the National Joint Council (NJC) based on agreed-upon criteria.
full_summary:
===============

**Tender Announcement**
------------------------

### Introduction

The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat (TBS) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the Determination of Kilometric Rates for Mileage Reimbursements. This tender opportunity is open to all qualified bidders.

### Tender Details

*   **Title**: Determination of Kilometric Rates for Mileage Reimbursements
*   **Reference Number**: SOL-24566-12345
*   **Amendment Number**: 1
*   **Solicitation Number**: 24062-22-299
*   **Publication Date**: July 24, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date**: September 1, 2023, 14:00:00 EST
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: September 1, 2023
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: March 31, 2030

### Scope of Work

The successful bidder will be responsible for determining the kilometric rates for mileage reimbursements for two National Joint Council (NJC) directives:

*   NJC Travel Directive
*   NJC Commuting Assistance Directive

The bid must include the implementation of a methodology for calculating the kilometric rates and lower kilometric rates, as outlined in the NJC Guides to Rates and Allowances.

### Selection Criteria

The selection criteria for this tender are based on the Lowest Cost-per-Point method.

### Trade Agreements

This tender opportunity is open to all bidders who are eligible under the following trade agreements:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

### Regions of Opportunity

This tender opportunity is open to bidders who are capable of delivering services in the following regions:

*   National Capital Region (NCR)

### Contracting Entity Information

The contracting entity for this tender is the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat.

*   **Address**: 90 Elgin Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0R5, Canada
*   **Contact Person**: Dawn Dormer
